question: A 17-year-old male presents to the emergency department with the complaint of bleeding from the nose after suffering a trauma. Which of the following is the most common site of epistaxis?

A 20-year-old male reports to the clinic after a flight with complaints of bilateral severe earache, deafness, and tinnitus. Otoscopy reveals bubbles in the middle ear across a retracted eardrum. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 24-year-old male visits the clinic with a complaint of a swelling in the floor of the oral cavity that ruptures and reappears on and off for the last 2 years. Oral examination reveals a transparent globular cystic swelling in the floor of the mouth. What is the most likely clinical diagnosis?

A 28-year-old female visits the outpatient department with complaints of restricted mouth opening, burning of the mouth, and intolerance to spicy food. She is habitual of chewing betel nuts for the last 12 years. Which premalignant condition is most likely to be present in this patient?

A 4-year-old girl is brought into the clinic by her mother with the complaint of bilateral hearing loss for the last 6 months. She has also been snoring at night. Otoscopy reveals fluid level with air bubbles in both ears along with dull, bluish, and retracted tympanic membranes. What is the most likely diagnosis of this patient?

answers.option: Safe type chronic suppurative otitis media

question: A 75-year-old lady comes to the clinic with the complaint of decreased hearing bilaterally. Her blood pressure is 145/98 mmHg and her ear examination is unremarkable. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A patient came with complaints of dyspnea in the emergency room. The doctor planned a high tracheostomy for his management. Which of the following is the indication of high tracheostomy?

A 21-year-old female, who had been in a road traffic accident 4 days ago, presents to the outpatient department with complaints of persistent swelling, bilateral nasal obstruction, and pain. Examination reveals a bulge on both sides of the nasal septum. Her temperature is 100.5 F. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 34-year-old patient presents to the outpatient clinic with complaints of sudden onset vertigo, tinnitus, and fluctuating hearing loss. This attack was preceded by a sensation of fullness in the affected ear. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 37-year-old man presents to the otorhinolaryngology clinic with the complaint of severe pain in his left ear. Examination reveals several vesicles on the tympanic membrane, meatal skin, and concha. What is the diagnosis?

A 40-year-old male presents to your office with the complaint of a change in his voice. Fiber optic direct laryngoscopy reveals paralyzed left vocal cord in the paramedian position. Which of the following muscles is the main abductor of the vocal cords?

A 45-year-old malnourished lady is having difficulty swallowing for the past 6 months. Oral cavity examination revealed smooth tongue and fissures at both angles of the mouth. Which of these diagnostic tests are required in this patient?

A 55-year-old woman comes to your office with the complaint of vertigo on turning her head to the right and while combing. Past history is relevant for a fall from the stairs around 5 years ago. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 60-year-old man is suffering from a gradual loss of hearing with tinnitus. His audiogram shows a notch at 4 kHz for both air and bone conduction. It is symmetrical on both sides. Which of the following is the cause of his hearing loss?

A 62-year-old male suffering from glottic squamous cell carcinoma comes to your clinic. Fiber optic direct laryngoscopy (FODL) reveals an exophytic growth on the right vocal cord. The right vocal cord is also fixed and immobile. Lymph nodes of the neck are not palpable. What is the tumor stage based on these findings?

A 63-year-old male farmer visits the outpatient department with the complaint of a non-healing right-sided buccal ulcer for the last 2 months. The ulcer is 3 x 2 cm in size. Examination reveals right-sided cervical lymphadenopathy on neck palpation. Which single investigation should be done to establish the diagnosis?

answers.option: MRI of oral cavity and neck
CT scan of oral cavity and neck

question: A 7-year-old child has undergone a tonsillectomy. Just after a few hours of surgery in the ward. He develops bleeding from the operative site. What is the type of hemorrhage?

A 70-year-old male patient presents to the clinic with complaints of feeling something sticking in his throat, difficulty in swallowing, and weight loss. He also gives a history of regurgitating undigested food 4 to 5 hours after consumption. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 75-year-old lady reports to the emergency department with the complaint of dysphagia to solids following ingestion of her denture. She undergoes esophagoscopy under general anesthesia for removal of the foreign body. Following the removal, she starts complaining about sharp interscapular pain. Which of the following is the most dangerous complication of this procedure?
A farmer develops long-standing late-stage atrophic rhinitis. Which of the following treatments is most preferable to eradicate the disease?
A mother brings in her 4-year-old boy to the clinic with complaints of severe right-sided earache, high-grade fever, and mild hearing impairment. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A pus swab for culture and sensitivity is sent for a 28-year-old man who is suffering from atticoantral type of chronic suppurative otitis media (CSOM). What is the most common organism causing this disease?

An 18-year-old male presents to the clinic with a diffuse swelling in the submandibular region, fever, ptyalism, and difficulty in chewing. He also gives a history of toothache. On examination, the swelling is diffuse, firm, and brawny with raised floor of the mouth. What is the most likely diagnosis?

answers.option: Between the glottic and epiglottic folds
Between the base of the skull and the superior constrictor muscle
Between the palatoglossal and palatopharyngeal arches
Between the thyropharyngeus and cricopharyngeus muscles
Between the upper and lower borders of the cricoid lamina

question: Noise is an undesirable and unwanted vibration of sound that can cause damage to humans both physically and mentally. The intensity of sound is measured in decibels (dB). Which of the following is the daily acceptable limit of noise that the human ear can tolerate without any substantial damage to hearing?

The professor of Medicine was reviewing the proformas constructed by the resident trainee. The proforma contained a consent form, patients’ socio-demographics such as name, age, gender, address, and clinical details on the severity of disease, antibiotics used, and the clinical outcome of the patient. The professor is also the principal investigator of this research titled “Effectiveness of antibiotics in the treatment of gastrointestinal infections”. Weber's test was centralized and Schwabach's test was equal to that of the examiner in both ears. Which of the following is the most likely explanation for these findings?

A 16-year-old boy is brought to the clinic for the evaluation of recurrent, bilateral profuse epistaxis and nasal obstruction. There is no history of recent trauma. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 16-year-old boy presented with right-side torticollis, a tender swelling behind the ear, and a fever. He has history of ear discharge for the past 6 years. Examination of the ear revealed a purulent discharge with granulations in the middle ear. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 16-year-old boy presents to the outpatient department with a complaint of severe earache with bleeding from his ear. On otoscopy, the tympanic membrane has red, hemorrhagic bullae. There is a history of upper respiratory tract infection. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 17-year-old boy presented with nasal obstruction, left cheek swelling, and epistaxis. Lateral X-ray nasopharynx is the showing anterior bowing of the posterior maxillary wall. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 17-year-old boy presents to the doctor's clinic with complaints of severe pain in the right side of his throat, severe odynophagia, high-grade fever, trismus, and dribbling of saliva for the last two days. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 20-year-old boy is complaining of severe sore throat and fever and also difficulty in swallowing for one week. His family physician gave him oral amoxiclave, but his condition further deteriorated. Neck examination revealed bilaterally enlarged and tender lymph nodes. He is also complaining of upper abdominal discomfort. What is the most likely organism that can cause this condition?
A 20-year-old female presents to the outpatient clinic with complaints of pain, redness, and swelling in her right ear for 5 days. She had her ears pierced a week ago. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 21-year-old female presents to the emergency department with complaints of pain in the throat, high-grade fever, ipsilateral earache, and restricted mouth opening. On examination, the patient has bulging of the soft palate and anterior tonsillar pillar of the affected side with congested and swollen tonsil. A 21-year-old female presents to the otorhinolaryngology outpatient department with the complaint of painless and progressive hearing loss. Her hearing is better in noisy surroundings. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 24-year-old woman comes to the clinic with complaints of severe vertigo and hearing loss for 4 days. She reports having had a similar attack 1 year ago that resolved without medications. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 25-year-old healthy female presents in the ENT outpatient department with the complaint of progressive increasing midline swelling of the neck for one year. On examination, it moves with swallowing. What is the most suitable radiological investigation for diagnosis?

A 25-year-old woman presents to the office with the complaint of nasal obstruction. Examination reveals a foul smell from the nose as well as roomy nasal cavities with greenish crusts. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 28-year-old woman, 26 weeks pregnant, presents to the outpatient department with complaints of ear pain for 2 weeks and discharge for 2 days. She did not have any convulsions or vomiting and the fever resolved yesterday. Which of the following antibiotics should not be given to this patient?
A 3-month-old child presents to the clinic with stridor which is aggravated by crying but gets better on lying prone. What is the most appropriate diagnosis?

A 3-year-old boy was brought with the complaint of unilateral foul-smelling and blood-stained discharge from the nose for the last two weeks. What is the most important condition that should be suspected first?

A 30-year-old male patient who had a history of left ear discharge for the past 5 years, now reported to the ENT clinic with the complaint of severe persistent headache, fever, and vomiting. What is the most probable diagnosis?
A 34-year-old female presents to the clinic with a history of dysphagia to solids for the past 3 years. Her hemoglobin is 7 mg/dl. What will be the most likely finding on a barium swallow?

A 35-year-old factory worker in Karachi, on his general check-up, is worried about noise-induced hearing loss. The physician advises him to limit his daily exposure to noise. A 35-year-old female presents with deep orbital pain and frontal headache. There is also a history of long-standing chronic sinusitis. On cranial nerve examination, there is palsy of cranial nerves 6, 3, and 4. The vision is normal. What is the most likely diagnosis?

Endoscopic ligation of external carotid artery

question: A 35-year-old male presented to the outpatient department with a complaint of a combination of fluctuating sensorineural hearing loss, roaring tinnitus, episodic vertigo, and fullness of the ear. What is the most likely diagnosis for this patient?

A 36-year-old female presents to her primary care physician with a complaint of difficulty in opening her mouth for the last 6 months. She has a history of chewing betel nuts for the last 10 years. A 40-year-old male comes to your office with the complaint of a change in his voice. Fibre optic direct laryngoscopy (FODL) reveals paralyzed left vocal cord in paramedian position (unilateral abductor paralysis). Which of the following nerves is most likely affected in this patient?
A 45-year-old female presents to the emergency department with severely painful nose swelling, malaise, and fever. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

He further explained that he applied for a transfer to an office job but his application was denied. He sought advice from the physician on how to avoid this annoyance. Which one of the following options is the most appropriate and practical advice that the doctor must give to the traffic warden?

answers.option: Plant a barrier from the traffic

question: A 55-year-old male chronic smoker presents with complaints of hoarseness and dyspnea. What will be the most appropriate next step?

answers.option: Course of antibiotics and steam inhalation

question: A 58-year-old man with a known comorbidity of diabetes mellitus for the past 10 years presents to the outpatient department with a complaint of developing sudden pain in the right ear with a fever. On examination, there is severe inflammation with small red swelling in the external auditory canal. The tympanic membrane is intact. The patient is most likely suffering from which condition?

answers.option: Squamous cell carcinoma of the ear

question: A 6-year-old boy came to the clinic with his mother with complaints of nasal obstruction, nasal discharge, and bedwetting at night. On examination, the patient had an open mouth, a pinched nose, and prominent incisors. What is the most probable diagnosis?

question: A professor is conducting research on a specific antibiotic. He asks a student to provide information about the patients treated with that specific antibiotic. answers.option: Hospitalization with intravenous fluids, antibiotics, analgesics, and maintenance of oral hygiene

question: An elderly man presents to the clinic with complaints of difficulty in swallowing and regurgitation of food contents at night. What is the most likely diagnosis?

answers.option: Base of the skull to the epiglottis

Base of the skull to the hyoid bone

question: Which of the following is the maximum safest loudness that a person can be exposed to daily without ear damage according to local guidelines?

question: Which of the following landmarks will be used to start drilling when performing surgery for mastoiditis?
Which of the following nerves pass through the internal acoustic meatus?
Which of the following organisms causes acute epiglottitis?
Which of the following structures forms the medial wall of the tympanic cavity?

A 10-year-old boy is brought to the clinic because of a 1-week history of pain while swallowing and decreased mouth opening. The boy also has an ongoing dental infection. Oral examination reveals that the tongue is lifted upwards and backward. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

answers.option: Regular follow-up till the age of 18 years

question: A 12-year-old girl is brought to the clinic with complaints of sore throat, coughs, low-grade fever, and malaise for 5 days. Upon general inspection, the child looks ill and lethargic. Vital signs show a temperature of 101 °F (37 °C), a heart rate of 88 beats per minute, and a thready pulse. Oral and throat examinations revealed a thick grey membrane adherent on the faucial tonsils and soft palate. A tongue depressor is used to scrape this membrane resulting in bleeding. Lymph nodes in the jugulodigastric region are palpable. A throat swab is taken and sent for culture. What is the best step in the management of this child's condition?

answers.option: Hospitalization, IV fluids, antitoxin, and emergency tonsillectomy

question: A 12-year-old presents in outpatient with a complaint of unilateral foul-smelling nasal discharge. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 13-year-old boy presents to the outpatient department with a history of profuse bleeding from his nose on and off, right-sided nasal blockage, and right-sided hearing impairment for the last 8 months. On anterior rhinoscopic examination, a pinkish mass is seen in the right nostril. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 13-year-old boy presents to the outpatient department with complaints of profuse and fresh red epistaxis for the past 1 year, decreased hearing, and a bulging cheek. What is the most probable diagnosis?
A 15-year-old child complains of hoarseness for the past two months. There is no history of cough or difficulty in breathing. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 15-year-old male presents to the clinic with complaints of high-grade fever and a sore throat. On examination, the spleen is found to be enlarged. What is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?

A 16-year-old boy presents to the outpatient department with a complaint of severe earache with bleeding from the ear. On otoscopy, the tympanic membrane has hemorrhagic bullae. He also has a history of upper respiratory infection. What is the most probable diagnosis?

CT scan of the head with contrast

question: A 17-year-old girl, who has a history of asthma and chronic allergic rhinitis presents with a 1-month history of persistent nasal congestion, rhinorrhoea, and headache. Her routine home medications include albuterol, nasal corticosteroids, and antihistamines. The physician decided to start a topical nasal decongestant that acts as an alpha-receptor agonist. A 19-year-old female presents with pain in her right ear, deafness, tinnitus, and discharge. On examination, a pearly white mass is observed in her ear canal. Upon removing the mass, an ulcer and granulation tissue are found in the widened external auditory canal. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 19-year-old hostel student presents to the outpatient department with the complaint of painful sores in his mouth for the past 2 weeks. Upon inspection, he is found to have pale yellow lesions with a red halo on the floor of the mouth. What is the probable diagnosis?

A 19-year-old male comes to the emergency department with complaints of severe pain in the right side of the throat, a thick muffled voice, and painful swallowing. Which of the following is not a clinical feature of quinsy (peritonsillar abscess)?

A 2-month-old infant is brought to the clinic with the complaint of noisy breathing with intercostal recession. During the examination, the noise during breathing disappeared when he was lying on his chest. What is the most likely diagnosis?

An x-ray fistulogram reveals that the fistula is communicating with the right tonsillar fossa interiorly. Which of the following is the origin of her congenital problem?

A 22-year-old girl presents to the clinic with painful ulceration on her lower lip. Examination reveals an 8 mm x 4 mm ulcer with a central necrotic area and a red halo. Which of the following is the most acceptable etiological factor for developing aphthous ulcers?
